sn35.240:1.4: The verb for “drawing in” (samodahati) here is almost identical with that for immersion (samādahati). The turtle “draws in” its five limbs as a meditator draws the mind in from the senses.
sn35.240:1.7: The verb abhininnāmeti (“sticks out”) is the same as that used for “extending” the mind to higher knowledges based on samādhi.
sn35.240:3.1: The text is notable for the omission of the stock phrase saying the Buddha spoke the verse. Either the verse was added by redactors (lifted from SN 1.17:3.1), or else the stock phrase has been abbreviated away.
